I'm sorry, but the world doesn't operate in this way. The role selection is there for a reason, and if you select two roles and get the one that wasn't your first pick, *you* need to choke down your pride and *you* need to deal with the fact that someone else got the role you didn't get. You can ask nicely, but if they decline, you can either throw a fit and act childish, or you can play what you were given and try to win the game. The guy who declines to trade roles with someone is not obligated to give up his role, and anyone who contests this and suddenly tilts is an asshat and shouldn't be playing with other people if they can't learn to be a team player and accept what they are given.

Youre young and naive if you dont think the world doesnt operate that way. 

Fair? Not really. But thats life.

erm, no. I'm EXTREMELY generous in exchanging roles. 9/10 if they ask nicely I'll say yes. This particular game, I wanted to play AD so I declined. they locked in cait anyways. Long story short, caitlyn top didn't work and we ff'd at 20. Not to mention that the support player was EXTREMELY new, unfroze my lane constantly and took a /lot/ of cs throughout the game. I assumed they were just trolling me for keeping my role at that point. Either way, just because you're boosting someone doesn't mean that you're always going to get your role, and when you don't you can't throw a tantrum. It's NOT my fault that I was put as adc, it's NOT being stubborn if I was given a role that I wanted to play, and I'm NOT letting people bully me over a game just because they're man-children.
